sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Performance Art Symposium At The Momentary
posts.content:
Over the weekend there will be a Performance Art Symposium by INVERSE at The Momentary.

  • Experience: INVERSE is an artist run, community supported platform that fosters conversation and connection via performance art. The Symposium this weekend will feature 8 national and international artists who will lead audiences through explorative and expressive solo and group performances inspired by current issues. 
  • See and do more: Wondering how to spend your time at the Museum? Check out their Winter 2021 Guide for a list of events, performances, and experiences.

Information and tickets to this weekends event can be found HERE.

posts.title: Diversity NWAs List Of Eateries To Try
posts.content:
Are you looking for a more diverse menu this holiday season or maybe a new restaurant to try with the family?

  • Stop on by: Diversity NWA has compiled a list of a few of their favorite diverse eateries for you to explore and enjoy while supporting locally owned restaurants. From Indian food at Punjabi Kitchen to Cajun at Cafe Rue Orleans, you’re bound to be in for an experience. 
  • At home: You could even take a it a step further and try a new recipe at home for a fun activity and get your ingredients at a local, authentic market. NWA has authentic Hispanic, Asian, and Indian markets where you can find everything you'd need for a home cooked meal.

Check out Diversity NWA’s eatery list HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Lion Club To Retire After 75yrs
posts.content:
After 75 years, the Rogers chapter of Lions Club International will cease operations at the end of 2021. 

  • Service: The Rogers Lion Club was the 2nd ever civic club to be chartered by the city. It has provided vision and hearing services to Rogers since its inception in 1946, and throughout the years has worked closely with schools and non-profits to assist in the community. 
  • To remember: Due to a decline in membership, the club will retire but will live on in preserved history and memories. 7 decades worth of club memorabilia will be added to the Rogers Historical Museum for people to see for generations, so be on the look out for that.

Read the full story HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.photoCredit: NWA Daily (North Forest Light at CBMAA)
posts.content:
Happy weekend everyone! It's here at last. Here are a few suggestions for some weekend fun!!

  • Festive: Don't miss out on the Bentonville Christmas parade this Saturday evening.
  • Symphony: Get festive at SoNA's Christmas performances in Fayetteville this Saturday and Sunday.
  • Crafty: Local makers and artisans will be in Springdale for the annual The Little Craft Show on Saturday.
  • Film: Take the family, grab some popcorn, and watch The Polar Express at the Victory Theatre.
  • Laugh: Grab a beer and sit in for a comedy act at Bike Rack in Bentonville!
  • Vendors: The pop-upThe Big Holigay Market is going to be at Ozark Beer Company on Saturday from 10-5p.
  • Glimmer: We highly recommend checking out the North Forest Lights before they're gone!
  • Handmade: Alright you pottery lovers, U of A ceramics students are hosting a sale on Saturday.

See you bright and early Monday morning!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Making a list: After you've written your letter to Santa, you can mail it here.
  • Shopping: The Arkansas Natural's baseball team store is open and full of potential gifts to help you hit a home run.
  • Hit the road: Catch the weekly community MTB ride in Bentonville today during lunch.
  • Safe and Sound: An African Serval has joined the Turpentine Creek Refuge Family.
  • Landscape: The City of Fayetteville is planning for a prescribed burn on the west side of town.
  • Do tell: Have a story? Let's talk about getting it in the newsletter.
